prompts.proposer: Call proposer_brief_tool() FIRST. Then select candidates by name and choose a score_preset. Return ONLY JSON per instructions. IMPORTANT: you MUST ONLY reference candidate names that appear in the tool output candidate_library; unknown names will hard-stop.
prompts.skeptic:
Chame build_debate_packet_tool() PRIMEIRO (inputs via context). Depois retorne APENAS JSON (sem markdown) com add_names, remove_names, params_overrides, rationale, changes, when_good.
IMPORTANT: you MUST ONLY use candidate names from valid_candidate_names; unknown names hard-stop.
You may only remove/override candidates that are in current_candidate_names (or candidates you are adding).
valid_candidate_names: ["baseline_mean", "best_per_horizon_by_validation", "best_single_by_validation", "inverse_rmse_weights_k10_sh0.00", "inverse_rmse_weights_k10_sh0.15", "inverse_rmse_weights_k10_sh0.25", "inverse_rmse_weights_k10_sh0.30", "inverse_rmse_weights_k10_sh0.35", "inverse_rmse_weights_k10_sh0.50", "inverse_rmse_weights_k2_sh0.00", "inverse_rmse_weights_k2_sh0.15", "inverse_rmse_weights_k2_sh0.25", "inverse_rmse_weights_k2_sh0.30", "inverse_rmse_weights_k2_sh0.35", "inverse_rmse_weights_k2_sh0.50", "inverse_rmse_weights_k3_sh0.00", "inverse_rmse_weights_k3_sh0.15", "inverse_rmse_weights_k3_sh0.25", "inverse_rmse_weights_k3_sh0.30", "inverse_rmse_weights_k3_sh0.35", "inverse_rmse_weights_k3_sh0.50", "inverse_rmse_weights_k5_sh0.00", "inverse_rmse_weights_k5_sh0.15", "inverse_rmse_weights_k5_sh0.25", "inverse_rmse_weights_k5_sh0.30", "inverse_rmse_weights_k5_sh0.35", "inverse_rmse_weights_k5_sh0.50", "ridge_stacking_l2100_topk3", "ridge_stacking_l2100_topk5", "ridge_stacking_l220_topk3", "ridge_stacking_l220_topk5", "ridge_stacking_l250_topk3", "ridge_stacking_l250_topk5", "robust_median", "topk_mean_per_horizon_k10", "topk_mean_per_horizon_k2", "topk_mean_per_horizon_k3", "topk_mean_per_horizon_k5", "trimmed_mean_r0.05", "trimmed_mean_r0.10", "trimmed_mean_r0.20", "trimmed_mean_r0.30"]
current_candidate_names: ["baseline_mean", "inverse_rmse_weights_k5_sh0.35", "topk_mean_per_horizon_k5"]
prompts.statistician:
Chame build_debate_packet_tool() PRIMEIRO (inputs via context). Depois retorne APENAS JSON (sem markdown) com add_names, remove_names, params_overrides, rationale, changes, when_good.
IMPORTANT: you MUST ONLY use candidate names from valid_candidate_names; unknown names hard-stop.
You may only remove/override candidates that are in current_candidate_names (or candidates you are adding).
valid_candidate_names: ["baseline_mean", "best_per_horizon_by_validation", "best_single_by_validation", "inverse_rmse_weights_k10_sh0.00", "inverse_rmse_weights_k10_sh0.15", "inverse_rmse_weights_k10_sh0.25", "inverse_rmse_weights_k10_sh0.30", "inverse_rmse_weights_k10_sh0.35", "inverse_rmse_weights_k10_sh0.50", "inverse_rmse_weights_k2_sh0.00", "inverse_rmse_weights_k2_sh0.15", "inverse_rmse_weights_k2_sh0.25", "inverse_rmse_weights_k2_sh0.30", "inverse_rmse_weights_k2_sh0.35", "inverse_rmse_weights_k2_sh0.50", "inverse_rmse_weights_k3_sh0.00", "inverse_rmse_weights_k3_sh0.15", "inverse_rmse_weights_k3_sh0.25", "inverse_rmse_weights_k3_sh0.30", "inverse_rmse_weights_k3_sh0.35", "inverse_rmse_weights_k3_sh0.50", "inverse_rmse_weights_k5_sh0.00", "inverse_rmse_weights_k5_sh0.15", "inverse_rmse_weights_k5_sh0.25", "inverse_rmse_weights_k5_sh0.30", "inverse_rmse_weights_k5_sh0.35", "inverse_rmse_weights_k5_sh0.50", "ridge_stacking_l2100_topk3", "ridge_stacking_l2100_topk5", "ridge_stacking_l220_topk3", "ridge_stacking_l220_topk5", "ridge_stacking_l250_topk3", "ridge_stacking_l250_topk5", "robust_median", "topk_mean_per_horizon_k10", "topk_mean_per_horizon_k2", "topk_mean_per_horizon_k3", "topk_mean_per_horizon_k5", "trimmed_mean_r0.05", "trimmed_mean_r0.10", "trimmed_mean_r0.20", "trimmed_mean_r0.30"]
current_candidate_names: ["baseline_mean", "best_single_by_validation", "topk_mean_per_horizon_k5"]

raw.proposer:
{
  "selected_names": [
    "baseline_mean",
    "topk_mean_per_horizon_k5",
    "inverse_rmse_weights_k5_sh0.35"
  ],
  "params_overrides": {},
  "score_preset": "balanced",
  "force_debate": false,
  "debate_margin": 0.0,
  "rationale": "High model disagreement (relative_spread_mean=3.69) warrants robust aggregation. Baseline_mean provides stability, topk_mean_per_horizon_k5 mitigates outlier impact, and inverse_rmse_weights_k5_sh0.35 leverages RMSE-based weighting while controlling overfitting via shrinkage."
}
raw.statistician:
{
  "add_names": ["inverse_rmse_weights_k5_sh0.35", "trimmed_mean_r0.20", "ridge_stacking_l250_topk5"],
  "remove_names": ["baseline_mean"],
  "params_overrides": {},
  "rationale": "Adding candidates with shrinkage=0.35 (inverse_rmse_weights_k5_sh0.35), trim_ratio=0.2 (trimmed_mean_r0.20), and l2=50 (ridge_stacking_l250_topk5) aligns with recommended_knobs for small n_windows. Removing baseline_mean improves stability as it has higher SMAPE/POCID than top performers.",
  "changes": [
    {
      "name": "inverse_rmse_weights_k5_sh0.35",
      "field": "add_names",
      "from": null,
      "to": "inverse_rmse_weights_k5_sh0.35",
      "reason": "Recommended shrinkage=0.35 improves stability for small n_windows"
    },
    {
      "name": "trimmed_mean_r0.20",
      "field": "add_names",
      "from": null,
      "to": "trimmed_mean_r0.20",
      "reason": "Trim_ratio=0.2 reduces outlier sensitivity per recommended_knobs"
    },
    {
      "name": "ridge_stacking_l250_topk5",
      "field": "add_names",
      "from": null,
      "to": "ridge_stacking_l250_topk5",
      "reason": "L2=50 regularization matches recommended_knobs for robustness"
    },
    {
      "name": "baseline_mean",
      "field": "remove_names",
      "from": "baseline_mean",
      "to": null,
      "reason": "Higher SMAPE (0.767) and POCID (66.67) than top performers"
    }
  ],
  "when_good": "When n_windows ≤ 12 and stability is prioritized over marginal accuracy gains"
}

proposer.rationale: High model disagreement (relative_spread_mean=3.69) warrants robust aggregation. Baseline_mean provides stability, topk_mean_per_horizon_k5 mitigates outlier impact, and inverse_rmse_weights_k5_sh0.35 leverages RMSE-based weighting while controlling overfitting via shrinkage.

skeptic.rationale: inverse_rmse_weights_k5_sh0.35 shows unstable performance (high RMSE_std) and lower score than topk_mean_per_horizon_k5. Adding best_single_by_validation (RMSE 652.05) improves RMSE vs current candidates. Increasing trim_ratio to 0.2 and reducing l2 to 50 aligns with recommended knobs for few-window stability.

changes.name: inverse_rmse_weights_k5_sh0.35
changes.reason: unstable performance with high RMSE_std (376.44) and lower score (0.9247) vs topk_mean_per_horizon_k5 (0.9408)

changes.name: best_single_by_validation
changes.reason: shows best RMSE (652.05) in universe leaderboard and stable performance

skeptic.when_good: when n_windows is small (3) and model performance variance is high

statistician.rationale: Adding candidates with shrinkage=0.35 (inverse_rmse_weights_k5_sh0.35), trim_ratio=0.2 (trimmed_mean_r0.20), and l2=50 (ridge_stacking_l250_topk5) aligns with recommended_knobs for small n_windows. Removing baseline_mean improves stability as it has higher SMAPE/POCID than top performers.

changes.name: inverse_rmse_weights_k5_sh0.35
changes.reason: Recommended shrinkage=0.35 improves stability for small n_windows

changes.name: trimmed_mean_r0.20
changes.reason: Trim_ratio=0.2 reduces outlier sensitivity per recommended_knobs

changes.name: ridge_stacking_l250_topk5
changes.reason: L2=50 regularization matches recommended_knobs for robustness

changes.name: baseline_mean
changes.reason: Higher SMAPE (0.767) and POCID (66.67) than top performers

statistician.when_good: When n_windows ≤ 12 and stability is prioritized over marginal accuracy gains
